instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.C7125: What is C7125? Capacitor between CHGR_BOOT and CHGR_PHASE important for bootstrapping creation of PPBUS_G3H on 2013-2015 macbook pros.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage ISL no PPBUS
threads.message:
Board came in with major liquid damage on ISL and surrounding components.  Replaced ISL and repaired all damaged traces the best that I can.   

[url]https://photos.app.goo.gl/eeELDEhBkWtdzGS6A[/url]


1.520V on PPBUS / .134 Diode Mode

1.520 at pin 1 of L7130

16.69V on DCIN

16.69V on Pins 1,2,3 of <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>

3.9V ACIN on ISL

17/18 of isl 4ohm

27/28 of isl 20 ohm

pin 21 of isl - 0v

pin 23 of isl1.525V

pin 24 of isl - 1.526V

I have replaced - <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>


Any help would be awesome. Thanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage ISL no PPBUS
threads.message:
<CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR> is there and good?
Be sure to have continuity from Gs/<TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> to <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.

Resistance to ground on L7130?
Post more voltages for <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>; 10, 11, 12, 13, 14, 9, 15, 19, 20.
Do you have magsafe light?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage ISL no PPBUS
threads.message:
Green/orange Light on charger.

Good continuity between <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> is good.


0.911K resistance on L7130

pin 10 - 3.30V - 3.419V (Jumps)
pin 11 - 3.301V - 3.423V (Jumps)
pin 12 - 2.66V
pin 13 - 3.218V
pin 14 - 3.118V
pin 15 - .061V
pin 19 - 5.45V
pin 20 - 5.46V

<CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR> is present. Not sure how to check if it is good so I swapped it.

Thanks!

Sometimes green light flickers  for a little while before going to amber.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage ISL no PPBUS
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage ISL no PPBUS
threads.message:
I should have saw that... 

Ran wire from <RESISTOR>R7112</RESISTOR> to pin 12 and <CAPACITOR>C7012</CAPACITOR> and still only 1.5v on PPBUS.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage ISL no PPBUS
threads.message:
Do you have correct voltage at pin12 now?
Post pins 1, 9, 26 voltage too.
I bet you still have some traces/resistors affected there...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage ISL no PPBUS
threads.message:
Pin 12 is 3.427V

Pin 1 - 0.003V
Pin 9 - 4.265V
Pin 26 - 0.018

it was pretty beat up. Your most likely right.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage ISL no PPBUS
threads.message:
"Pin 9 - 4.265V"
There is your problem.
Check again resistance between pins 27/28; directly on the chip!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage ISL no PPBUS
threads.message: Sorry for the delayed response  have been closed for a while here from the holiday. You were right! Thank you very much! There was a pinhole in TP between pin 27 and pin 2 of <CAPACITOR>C7120</CAPACITOR>. Sorry for the wild goose chase man, I honestly couldn't see it and my joints on the isl looked strong, so I assumed I had good connectivity. Didn't mean to waste your time, because I do appreciate it.  So, I do have ppbuss back but still not turning on. I don't trust this battery so I ordered a couple new ones. Will post back, have a good one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage ISL no PPBUS
threads.message:
Do you get correct <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> now (aprox 12.5V)?
The board should start without battery, just plug in the magsafe.
